description: The Sundarbans is the largest mangrove forest in the world, known for its rich biodiversity and the Royal Bengal tigers.
Cox's Bazar is famous for having one of the longest natural sea beaches in the world, attracting tourists for its pristine beauty.
Known as the 'Tea Capital of Bangladesh,' Srimangal is famous for its lush tea gardens and biodiversity.
Ratargul is the only swamp forest in Bangladesh and is known for its serene beauty and boat rides through the swamp.
